content: 3 stitches from the end k2tog k1 round 4 continue with k3 p1 pattern on n1 and n2 instep needles knit all stitches on n3 and n4 repeat rounds 1 to 4 to decrease the gusset until you have a total of 56 64 72 stitches or 14 16 18 stitches on each of your 4 needles then continue knitting n1 and n2 in the k3 p1 pattern and n3 and n4 in stockinette until the foot of the sock measures approx 1 5 inches 3 5 cm shorter than your desired foot length from back of your heel to end of your big toe tip if you like you can choose to continue the rib pattern all round the sock in other words on all 4 needles toe decrease round 1 n1 k1 ssk k to end n2 k to 3 stitches before end k2tog k1 n3 k1 ssk k to end n4 k to 3 stitches before end k2tog k1 round 2 k across all stitches n1-n4 repeats rounds 1 and 2 above until only 7 8 9 stitches remain on each needle total 28 32 36 stitches distribute evenly on 2 needles with your tapestry needle close the toe using the kitchener stitch or 3 needle bind off technique weave in ends soak and block if desired congratulations you re done now you re ready to go ahead with sock two 5 © the kitchen sink shop abbreviations k knit p purl n - needle ssk slip 1 stitch knit wise onto right needle slip another stitch knit wise onto right needle then knit the two stitches together k2tog knit 2 stitches together as one stitch p2tog purl 2 stitches together as one stitch s1 knitwise - slip one stitch knit wise with yarn held in back s1 purl wise - slip one stitch purl wise with yarn held in front rs right side of work ws wrong side of work questions email me at thekitchensinkshop@gmail com i d love to see your oma s sokken tag me @thekitchensinkshop #omassokken 6 © the kitchen sink shop
